Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2019 11:22PM ShinyLife wrote: Kishcorbin, I just had the same thing. Discordant benign core needle biopsy on 12/4. Excisional biopsy was on the 10th. Doc called the next day to share that the path findings were again benign. I don’t have a copy of the path report yet. A rare tumor can still be benign, so hopefully that’s all it is. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Discordant benign biopsy Kushcobain ShinyLife

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2019 04:41PM ShinyLife wrote: Could also be that the radiologist and pathologist are going back and forth. I started calling to get my results about 5 days post CNB. They gave me the results that were in, benign. But then has to follow up the next week that it’s discordant. Almost might have been easier waiting until radiology and pathology had finished conferring. Hang in there

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2019 12:55PM ShinyLife wrote: Hi SarBar, With the exception of not being palpable, your findings are almost identical to mine. I'm sure three weeks seems like an eternity right now, but it's not. I'm approaching two months since my architectural distortion finding and will hopefully have a final answer next week after tomorrow's excisional biopsy. So you're not alone. I've been trying to focus on being present with my family during the holidays, but that's easier said than done.
